alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 8:32AM CST until January 27 at 6:33AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New Orleans LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tchefuncte River Above U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington affecting St. Tammany Parish. Tchefuncte River Near Folsom affecting St. Tammany Parish. For the Tchefuncte River...including Folsom, U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tchefuncte River Above U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Water will invade Camp Tchefuncte`s parking lot. Vehicles must be removed to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 21.0 feet early Thursday afternoon. The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.7 feet on 03/14/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
